bibl.title: Note from the Archive of Dioscorus. Apollos Son of Dioscorus in P. Cairo Mus. inv. 3733 (37) Again.
bibl.note: P. Cair. Inv. SR 3733 (37) (= S.B. XVI, 12370). The date is 559 A.D. Apollos is the son of the poetical advocate Dioscorus and not his father. The pagarch Kometes was Julianus's colleague in 559 A.D., before his collegiality with Menas.
HANAFI Alia, Note from the Archive of Dioscorus. Apollos Son of Dioscorus in P. Cairo Mus. inv. 3733 (37) Again.
